snippet: Lawyers from Weitz & Luxenberg testified about the referrals Mr. Silver, a former New York Assembly speaker, sent to their firm and how he was compensated for those services.
abstract: Lawyers from Weitz & Luxenberg testify at corruption trial of former New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver that his income at firm came from referrals, not actual legal work; say he provided profitable cases to firm for over decade.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and BENJAMIN WEISER

lead_paragraph: Lawyers from Weitz & Luxenberg testified about the referrals Mr. Silver, a former New York Assembly speaker, sent to their firm and how he was compensated for those services.

headline.main: Sheldon Silver Was Paid for Referrals, Not Legal Work, Law Firm Leader Says at Trial
headline.print_headline: Law Firm Paid Ex-Speaker for Referrals, Leader Says
